IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik, preteklik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
A set of things
je več stvari, ki tvorijo smiselno celoto.

seg.quote: ...a set of encyclopaedias.
...a chess set.
We soon encountered a new set of problems.

sense.def:
To set something somewhere
pomeni tisto stvar nekam dati, zlasti previdno ali z določenim namenom.

seg.quote: He filled the kettle and set it on the stove.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
set in a particular place or position
, je na določenem kraju ali v določenem položaju.

seg.quote: The house is set back from the road.
His eyes were set close together.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
set into a surface
, je pritrjeno v neko površino in ne štrli iz nje.

seg.quote: There was one tiny window set into the stone wall.
...nine large panels set in a rich framework.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
ADJUNCT, ADJ,
or
-ING

sense.def:
Besedo
set
uporabljamo tudi, kadar hočemo reči, da nekdo ali nekaj povzroči, da se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: Let me set your mind at rest.
One prisoner had been set free.
Two further pieces of information set me questioning it all again.

sense.def:
Kadar sonce
sets
, izgine za obzorjem.

To set a trap
pomeni pripraviti past.

To set the table
pomeni pred obrokom razvrstiti krožnike in jedilni pribor na mizo.

To set a clock
pomeni nastaviti urni mehanizem tako, da kaže ali začne delovati ob določenem času.
To set a control
pomeni postaviti nadzorni mehanizem na določeno vrednost.

seg.quote: His alarm clock was set for four a.m.

sense.def:
To set a time, price, or level
pomeni odločiti, kdaj, po kakšni ceni ali na kakšni ravni nekaj bo.

seg.quote: They haven't set a date for the wedding.
The government set a minimum price of £1.15.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
set
opišemo nekaj, kar je točno določeno in se ne spreminja.

seg.quote: We paid a set amount for the course.
Her day usually followed a set pattern.

sense.def:
To set a precedent, standard, or example
pomeni narediti nekaj, kar bodo drugi posnemali ali poskušali doseči.

seg.quote: Try and set the younger children a good example.
They tended to follow the trend set by the other banks.

sense.def:
To set someone some work
ali
to set a target
pomeni reči, da mora nekdo opraviti neko delo ali doseči cilj, ki mu ga določimo.

seg.quote: Let me set you a little problem.
It set a target for economic growth.

sense.def:
To be set to do something
pomeni, da je nekdo pripravljen nekaj narediti ali da bo tisto zelo verjetno naredil.

seg.quote: The left-wing seem set to do very well in the general election.

sense.def:
To be set on doing something
pomeni trdno skleniti, da bomo nekaj naredili.

seg.quote: She is set on regaining her title.

sense.def:
Kadar lepilo, žele ali beton
sets
, postane trd.

seg.quote: The cement had set hard.

sense.def:
To set a poem to music
pomeni napisati glasbo za neko pesem.

A television set
je televizija.

seg.quote: We have a TV set in the living room.

sense.def:
The set for a play or film
je oprema prizorišča ali pohištvo v gledališki igri ali filmu.

Kadar igra, film ali zgodba
is set at a particular time or in a particular place
, se dogaja v določenem času ali na določenem kraju.

seg.quote: The play is set in a small Midlands village.

sense.def:
A set
je pri tenisu ena izmed skupin šestih ali več iger, ki sestavljajo tekmo.

To set about doing something
pomeni začeti nekaj delati.

seg.quote: The next morning they set about cleaning the house.

sense.def:
To set one person against another
pomeni povzročiti, da dva človeka postaneta sovražnika ali tekmeca.

Kadar neka lastnost
sets someone apart from other people
, se tista oseba razlikuje od drugih po tisti značilnosti.

seg.quote: His exceptional height set him apart from the rest of the men.

sense.def:
To set something aside
pomeni hraniti nekaj za posebno uporabo ali namen.

seg.quote: Try and set aside time to do some mending jobs.

sense.def:
To set aside a belief, principle, or feeling
pomeni ne dovoliti, da bi določeno prepričanje, načelo ali čustvo vplivalo na nas.

seg.quote: We must try and set aside our past hostilities.

sense.def:
To set someone or something back
pomeni povzročiti, da nekdo ali nekaj zamuja.

seg.quote: This has set back the whole programme of nuclear power in America.

sense.def:
To set down one's thoughts or experiences
pomeni prenesti svoje misli ali doživetja na papir.

seg.quote: They were asked to set down a summary of their views.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj neprijetnega
sets in
, se začne dogajati in se bo verjetno nadaljevalo ali razvijalo.

seg.quote: A feeling of anti-climax set in.
It must be treated quickly before infection sets in.

sense.def:
To set off
pomeni začeti potovanje.

seg.quote: He set off on a trip to Mexico.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
sets off an event or a series of events
, povzroči dogodek ali niz dogodkov.

To set animals on someone
pomeni povzročiti, da živali nekoga napadejo.

seg.quote: We were afraid they might set the dogs on us.

sense.def:
To set out
pomeni začeti potovanje.

seg.quote: They set out for Cuba.

sense.def:
To set out to do something
pomeni začeti si prizadevati, da bi nekaj naredili.

seg.quote: They had failed in what they had set out to do.

sense.def:
To set things out
pomeni urediti položaj stvari ali jih postaviti na ogled.

seg.quote: There were plenty of chairs set out for the guests.

sense.def:
To set out facts or opinions
pomeni povedati dejstva ali mnenja na jasen, urejen način.

seg.quote: Darwin set out his theory in ‘The Origin of Species’.

sense.def:
To set something up
pomeni izpeljati potrebne priprave za nekaj.

seg.quote: It took a long time to set up the experiment.
The government were setting up an inquiry into the affair.
An anti-terrorist squad was set up.
...the setting up of a Northern Seas Environmental Control Agency.

sense.def:
To set up a structure
pomeni nekaj nekje namestiti ali zgraditi.

seg.quote: A fund was launched to set up a monument in memory of the dead men.

sense.def:
To set up somewhere
pomeni začeti živeti v novem domu ali odpreti svoje podjetje.

seg.quote: She left her parents' home and set up on her own.
He used the money to set himself up in business.

sense.def:
To set someone up
pomeni ustvariti vtis, da je nekdo naredil nekaj slabega, čeprav to ni res;
